posts.body: Marxist here; It's interesting to see how the right tries to paint everyone they disagree with as some kind of stereotype. This is nothing more than a (not so) thinly veld ad-hominem attack and does not actually address the critiques of the system of capital levied against it's upholders. I work, I work hard. Some times I get less than 10 hours of sleep a week I work so hard. It's interesting to see first hand how inane your ideology actually is.

>>84192164-e5d9-40f3-bad0-e6334dd9cfcd
Trust me no one knows better than me that the right are not actually my enemies; The right are who I try to reach out too everyday and, with some, success. The thing is, ultimately, yes the right and the left have ideologically opposed economic views. The right upholds the economic mode of capitalism at the end of the day. Your idea of "Socialism" is really just a form of class collaborationism. I'm not new here I just suffle my ID around every so often.

>>dbd93750-4d95-48ee-97b9-27ee4e8e42d1
>>397592cc-6aef-440c-99a4-c692beab2738
More ad-hmoniem and no real arguments being made. At the end of the day the profitable nature of capitalism is and will drive humanity further and further towards the brink of social, cultural, and economic collapse.

Wether you like to admit it or not, the nature of capitalism pushes further and further the people you seek to drive together apart; and all of humanity. An informed thinking population is not profitable to them. 

They want everyone to become totally isolated and atomized consumers. You are playing right into their hands. Not the jews, the capitalist class.

posts.subject: Does anyone have that list of seeds?
posts.body: I remember when this place first opened up there was a list of seeds that existed that made my peer count jump from like 11-12 too almost 90 some times 100 peers. Can anyone help me out?

Bruh I wish I could find an active BBS  to join. I was lurking a few for a while, but, none were that active so I just got bored.
It sounds great. I wish I would have been born in that time in internet history.

>>ea502143-9a53-4ab5-a233-625107de39f8
lol, even newfags can make their way here. Things are looking up.

Also, fuck you OP.
I had to upload it from a file if anyone can remember. I'm surprised I Couldn't find it in the catalogue

>>a5ba6516-bb1f-40a6-a3a0-60914e33ec31
Damn anon you got a lot of errors, dawg.

Wonder how much longer it will be til they just outright monitor and watch every one. If you faggots thought that the KGB was bad you haven't seen shit yet. Capitalism as it exists today is far, far, far more surveillance heavy than any cheka running around trying to find people of interest in the DDR.
Post more of this glorious fucking architecture.

>>d1043671-e293-47f9-9f7e-811d10e7c7b2
The left has memes too; The right has pepes and wojacks. The memes are what brought me into the left, actually. And I don't dislike the pepe and wojack memes either I just find a certain appeal in the aesthetics f leftist ones. And yeah, I mean, I am not just brushing it off as an ad-hominem, but, I think the point of any conversation like this one is to put our ideological rigor to the test and that means discussions about our economic and political ideology and how they hold up to one another. Not speculations about whom one another may or may not be. This is an image-board; the whole purpose of the existence of it is to defeat that purpose. That's really what I was getting at

>>16daa0fb-0e6e-4145-80ed-3c5bfe42a8f9
Communism is not, at its core, a top down hierarchcail mode of production. Ideally, communism as is understood by us, communists, means a society in which the state, class, money, and the generalized production of commodities has been abolished and replaced with a classless, stateless, moneyless society in whcih the production of goods has been put directly into the hands of the workers.

In other words, those who run the mills should own them. The working classes should have control over their lives and their work places. Work places should not be dominated by an oligarch group of people with total control over the worlds resources. That is the ideas of communism that is most commonly shared by \all communists and socialists.

Now the struggle and how to achieve that point or better the lives of people before that point is actually the topic most debated between leftists of varying ideologies. Most people I have interacted with tend to take a bottom up, at least some what, decentralized approach too it. Such as a form of labor unions or syndicalistic types of economic modes of production to replace localities of capital accumulation.
Can you stop spamming the board with your shitty threads?

>>8a954bb4-3057-4697-a0af-21288e29b002
Yeah ok buddy. It's not my fault you made it all the way too 08chan and still can't figure out how imageboards work.

>>7e1100df-0bc1-4e63-a904-77f0fcf5e6ce
And yet currently you adhere too the ideological doctorins of the market and capital and do not realize it. Marxism, E.G Dialectical materialism is not logic of doctrine or dogma. Quite the contrary it is a logic of continual change. Ideology is to be done away with and only the constant shaping and grasping of history is to be retained. So long as you have class you will have contradictory economic outcomes between the; outcomes in which one class is suppressed and dominated by the other.

>>82662dd4-e174-4f45-9e48-f7a58d314d1f
I don't know what you are talking about with manipulating people or where that came from. That is a total non-sequiter.
Are you salty about the thread thing? I was just pickin' baby. Don't be mad
